results.title: Introduction to Orchestra!: Upper strings. Woodwind
results.creator_credit: Declan Lowney, Jonathan Hewes and Initial (GB)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Orchestra!”.
This volume of the “Orchestra!” series provides an introduction to the methods and objectives of the series. It also examines the role of the the upper string instruments, violin and viola and the early work of Bach and Handel. It also examines the woodwind section focussing on the oboe and the use of a double reed.

results.title: Introduction to optics
results.creator_credit: Norton Bloom and Educational Services Incorporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.
Elbert P. Little discusses the approximation that light travels in a straight line and demonstrates how its direction is changed by diffraction, scattering, refraction and reflection. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Introduction to movement education (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Illustrates the enthusiastic reaction of children to the problem-solving approach to gymnastics. Explains movement language, teaching methods, and safety aspects. Presents movement education as a throught-provoking philosophy and an area of physical education catering for all levels of performance. Suitable for teacher tertiary levels.

results.title: Introduction to Microwave Cookery
results.brief_description: Virginia Hill presents a videotape that will take the mystery out of microwave cooking. Microwave cooking is easy, nutritious and fun when you know how. This tape takes the viewer through a step-by-step guide to the microwave oven and its effective use.

results.title: Introduction to Light Weight Training
results.brief_description: The benefits of light weight training are tremendous, toning and shaping your body to the best it can be. More and more people are incorporating weight training into their workout regimen with excellent results. Crystal Light National Aerobics Champion, Leslie Chazin, has designed an effective workout using light, free weights that will get you started safely. Included in her complete program is: Introduction; Warm-up, Upper body, Lower body, Cool down.

results.title: Introduction to jazz
results.creator_credit: Denis Sanders and University of California, Los Angeles. Dept. of Theater Arts
results.brief_description: A survey of the development of jazz in the United States from the time of its primnitive African source, through the wistful rhythms of the enslaved negroes of the South to the sophisticated jazz of modern times. The film features Freddy Leadbelly in the work-song “Take this hammer”, Louis Armstrong and his Hot Five, and the Red Hot Peppers in such numbers as “West end blues”, “Shoe shine drag” and “Jelly roll”. Narrated by Frank Wolff.

results.title: Introduction to horizontal jumping: long jump - triple jump
results.creator_credit: Ron Taylor and Department of Education, Queensland
results.brief_description: Provides an introduction to horizontal jumping. Shows flexibility and warm-up exercises and gives comprehensive information on run-up, take-off, flight and landing techniques.

results.title: Introduction to holography
results.creator_credit: Thomas Smith and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Holography is a recently discovered new means of recording images on photographic film. The technique was first conceived by Dennis Gabor in the late 1940’s. This film illustrates the basic principles of holography and some of the many optical effects possible with holography. Also considered is the value of holography as both a scientific tool and an artistic medium.
